publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-22 Donald Gorrie: Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of the Epilepsy Scotland free helpline as the precursor to Epilepsy Awareness Week from 18 to 24 May 2003; recognises the valuable role that the helpline will provide in helping the 30,000 families living with epilepsy and their carers to have better access to support and information, and further recognises the important work of Epilepsy Scotland in advocating on behalf of, and working with, Scottish families affected by epilepsy.
S2M-22 Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline (lodged on 13 May 2003) Robin Harper*, Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-22 Donald Gorrie: Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of the Epilepsy Scotland free helpline as the precursor to Epilepsy Awareness Week from 18 to 24 May 2003; recognises the valuable role that the helpline will provide in helping the 30,000 families living with epilepsy and their carers to have better access to support and information, and further recognises the important work of Epilepsy Scotland in advocating on behalf of, and working with, Scottish families affected by epilepsy. Supported by: Robin Harper, Carolyn Leckie, Ms Sandra White
S2M-22 Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline (lodged on 13 May 2003) Mark Ballard*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-22 Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline (lodged on 13 May 2003) Irene Oldfather*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, David Mundell*, Susan Deacon*

S2M-22 Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline (lodged on 13 May 2003) Michael Matheson*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Karen Gillon*, Robert Brown*, John Swinburne*, Elaine Smith*, Sarah Boyack*
S2M-22 Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline (lodged on 13 May 2003) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-22 Epilepsy Scotland Free Helpline (lodged on 13 May 2003) Mary Scanlon*
